title: 6:30pm AEST SIN Gaming AMA. 600IQ, JACKED, Alpha Male ONLY.
body:
**LISTEN!**

We're the 600IQ, Alpha Male, 6'5, Levi outsmiting **SIN Gaming** btw.
We'll be answering your questions LIVE from 6:30pm to 7:30pm AEST but feel free to post prior!

Our Roster is:

**Dhokla** (Top Lane): [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dhoklalol)

**Juves** (Jungle): [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SINJuves) / [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/notjuves) / [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/SINJuves/?ref=br_rs)

**Ry0ma** (Mid Lane): [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RyomaOCE)

**FBI **(AD Carry): [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SIN_FBI)

**Rogue** (Support): [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RogueOCE) / [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIEZOPgXItLBEfMSn53KzFQ) / [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/RogueOCE/)

**Bencel** (Coach): [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SINBencel)

For more SIN content check out our social media: [Official Website](http://singaming.gg) / [Twitter](https://twitter.com/SinOceania) / [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/SinOceania/)

Special thanks for everyone who supported us at Rift Rivals.
**FIGHTO!**

https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DD98jRwUIAAAUkH.jpg:large

replies.body: How long do I have to wait for Rogue to cosplay Pink Taric at an event?

What do you think life has in store for you post-OPL?
Also; if you could pick your opposition's team comp, what would it be?

Thats something thats been scaring me for a long time now, I have my degree (finished uni), I have family who are tradies, and I have e sports. The options are open for me I guess.

It would be:
Teemo
Yi
xerath
ezreal
nunu

> [{quoted}](name=eshanes,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-07-14T06:40:50.658+0000)
>
> What do you think life has in store for you post-OPL?

Post-OPL life for me will lead me back to NA any perhaps I can find an opportunity there
> Also; if you could pick your opposition's team comp, what would it be?

Enemy teamcomp would be {{champion:62}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:427}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:106}}

> [{quoted}](name=eshanes,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2017-07-14T06:40:50.658+0000)
>
> What do you think life has in store for you post-OPL?
> Also; if you could pick your opposition's team comp, what would it be?

I try not to think about that, it's a pretty big fear of mine, I have plenty more years of OPL to work out what to do with myself when my mechanics dry up and my hands fall off. 
5 flashless adc's for me to make montage plays on

Everyone:
1) What is your favourite offrole position in soloq, and why?
2) What was the biggest thing you took away from your time at Rift Rivals?

1) I struggle to find a main one.
2) The sweet Rift Rivals shirt was the biggest thing.

Jungle because i enjoy playing Lee and Nidalee
The gap isn't far between players from other regions.

> [{quoted}](name=loathey,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-07-14T06:26:08.952+0000)
>

> 1) What is your favourite offrole position in soloq, and why?

My favourite offrole is mid, you do HEAPS of damage and can roam a lot to impact the map, can't do that from top too much. 

> 2) What was the biggest thing you took away from your time at Rift Rivals?

Playing as a team is really important and Vietnamese internet > AUS internet
When is Juves replacing peanut. #SinWin.
Hi it me Juves, I am on my way to korea as we speak.
For Rogue, dominate me daddy?

> [{quoted}](name=zamalodchikova,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=0019,timestamp=2017-07-14T09:02:18.956+0000)
>
> For Rogue, dominate me daddy?

What is going on

Ryoma- How do you feel about being labelled the future best, if not best player in this region? Has it affected how you play the game and how you view your own gameplay?

Dhokla- How's your transition to full time professional league of legends been? Is this something you can see yourself doing in the future/long term? How do you feel about OCE as a server in comparison to NA?

FBI- How do you take your steak on a scale of rare to well done? And has it been difficult as a Marksman in Season 7? Do you think your role is as impactful as it has been in previous seasons?

Juves- What's it been like to see the team you created come so far as one of the original members? Do you miss playing soccer professionally at all and is it something you'd go back to if you ended your Pro League career?

Rogue- Do you think supports have a stronger impact on the game today in comparison to past seasons? Least favorite champion and why? 

Bencel- Are you a chess Grandmaster? 

Sebbie- If sin win finals will you dye your hair neon orange?

All- who is the most adequate on the team? :^)
I play chess, I'm a master and I'm grand so yes.

I still have faults as a player i'm setting personal goals for myself to achieve my goals, I have recently got a lot of compliments as a player and its made me have a lot more confidence in game and out of game.

> [{quoted}](name=Vendra,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2017-07-14T07:15:02.710+0000)
>

> Dhokla- How's your transition to full time professional league of legends been? Is this something you can see yourself doing in the future/long term? How do you feel about OCE as a server in comparison to NA?

> 
> All- who is the most adequate on the team? :^)

Transitioning into professional league was pretty easy, I was playing as much as I could at home and now I play as a job. 

I hope to see myself playing professionally as long as I can.

Server is considerably smaller in terms of players, especially in high elo. However there are good players here and hope more can come.

> [{quoted}](name=Vendra,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=0011,timestamp=2017-07-14T07:15:02.710+0000)
>
> Ryoma- How do you feel about being labelled the future best, if not best player in this region? Has it affected how you play the game and how you view your own gameplay?
> 
> Dhokla- How's your transition to full time professional league of legends been? Is this something you can see yourself doing in the future/long term? How do you feel about OCE as a server in comparison to NA?
> 
> FBI- How do you take your steak on a scale of rare to well done? And has it been difficult as a Marksman in Season 7? Do you think your role is as impactful as it has been in previous seasons?
> 
> Juves- What's it been like to see the team you created come so far as one of the original members? Do you miss playing soccer professionally at all and is it something you'd go back to if you ended your Pro League career?
> 
> Rogue- Do you think supports have a stronger impact on the game today in comparison to past seasons? Least favorite champion and why? 
> 
> Bencel- Are you a chess Grandmaster? 
> 
> Sebbie- If sin win finals will you dye your hair neon orange?
> 
> All- who is the most adequate on the team? :^)

Its something I always envisioned. I knew I could put together and play in one of the best OCE teams. I had alot of people helping me along the way but its a sense of pride, I couldnt play soccer anymore and I feel like I have achieved something in a scene and helped grow a scene that started from hard working people. I do miss playing soccer, I will 100% go back when I retire from League of Legends. I will not be able to go pro in soccer anymore though but semi professional is good enough for me.

I mean my hair is pretty orange as it is with the dye job...
I mean if someone paid for it then probably. :)

1. Was it easier to mentally prepare for your first international event when it was a fun event? Or was the burden of representing OCE still a large enough factor that you had to still overcome the mental hurdles before/during the event?

2. @all - Do you believe the biggest blocker that Oceania suffers at international events **IS** the mental aspect?

I think confidence is one of the most significant factors Oceania internationally. While overconfidence is a bad thing (cough... Direwolves... lesson learned...) it is soo much better than doubting your potential.

Hi its Juves the soloq goblin,

I think it was easy for me, I have had big matches in my soccer career that compare to what Rift Rivals was. The only mental hurdle I had to overcome was whether I was good enough to compete with international junglers because its no secret im no superstar in OCE but I think I held my own well. 

The biggest blocker from OCE to International is decision making and I guess that can come down to the mental aspect.. we may hesitate in big games on stage where the best wild card teams (GAM) just pull the trigger and have confidence.

1. I don't think we had any specific mental hurdles with the event itself, we had to deal with our own internal mental states during the event. It required a lot of being open with each other and I think the fun atmosphere of the event really helped with that.

2. For Oceania I think the biggest problem is the quality of our solo queue and not being able to scrim against other regions while at home. Higher quality solo queue really helps players develop better habits and better discipline in their day to day play.
Will Katy, the most beautiful girl on the planet. Go out with me?
Does dhokla miss NA soloq and his favorite mid laner?? gj at rift rivals bro

I miss kr midlaner 

Thanks

I felt really confident when i got Taliyah on my first game internationally, I believe the lethality buffs will make the AD Assassins stronger slightly
Thank you for the kind words !

> [{quoted}](name=CVY Guardian,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=0012,timestamp=2017-07-14T07:22:40.204+0000)
>

> 
> @Dhokla, how are you liking OCE? Better than NA right? In all seriousness, how does OCE SoloQ differ from NA SoloQ aside from toxicity? It's great to see you come to OCE. Enjoy your stay here and hope you guys do well again this split and hope you don't go back to NA :( 
> 


OCE is great! 
I think the main difference is the amount of people in each server, there are really good players in OCE, but the server size hinders more talent to prosper. 

Thanks!

Our schedule is somewhat dictated by what times our internet is good lol. We scrim and play solo queue when it's good (Usually not peak times) and then everyone can do their own thing like go gym, do uni work and review our own gameplay the rest of the time.

Generally our schedule is:

Breakfast then Scrims, Break/lunch then Scrims again, Dinner then Free time after.
Although that sounds really "loose" the players generally practice in their free time in Solo queue.
Bencel and I don't really enforce a very tight schedule as the boys do it themselves.

If you really want specifics...
Dhokla's Breakfast: Cereal (Cocoa Puffs with Milk).
Juves's Breakfast: 2 Sunny side up eggs on multigrain toast.
Ry0ma's Breakfast: 2 Scrambled eggs with bacon on white toast.
FBI's Breakfast: 2 Sunny side up eggs on white toast.
Rogue's Breakfast: 4 Sunny side up eggs on whatever toast there is.

:^)
as a professional player, what advice would you give to smaller teams of people striving to become pro gamers in the future?
Mechanics

Try to be friendly in soloq, you don't want a really bad reputation. 

Watch people better than you and copy what they do! Easiest way to improve.

Hi its Juves the soloq goblin,

Dont listen to anyone, even your own self doubt. I started this team from the ground up, and everyone said Id never make opl let alone an international tournament.
who is the most hung on the team? {{champion:40}} {{item:3504}}

Hi its Juves the soloq goblin,

not me

3 questions for mah boy Bencel
- What do you think of Denmark?
- What's your position on the "SIN ARAM"?
- Who has the highest IQ on SIN excluding Juves (he obviously has the highest)?

- Fook Yeah
- Mid obviously
- FBI has by far the biggest head so he must be able to fit a lot of IQ in there.

How did you guys like the experience of working with the other teams to take down GPL in the King of the Hill day, and what did you think could have been changed in the GAM game for you guys to beat them? {{summoner:14}}

Loved the region theme of RR, disliked day two's format, didn't really fit the theme of RR.

Changing our pathing early game would have helped us tremendously.
Levi was playing really well and they deserved to win.

> [{quoted}](name=belquin,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=aQzgF5ju,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-07-14T05:25:45.393+0000)
>
> How did you guys like the experience of working with the other teams to take down GPL in the King of the Hill day, and what did you think could have been changed in the GAM game for you guys to beat them? {{summoner:14}}

Hi its Juves the soloq goblin,

I think if we respected them less the game would be in the bag mate, We had so many oppurtunities to do things but we just respected them way to much. Hindsight is always a good thing right? haha.

If my carries flashed/dodged the Orianna ult in mid lane then that game could go totally differently. I think the boys definitely felt the nerves playing against the best team they've ever played against and that played a factor.
@juves how many wheetbix did the split 1 gauntlet run take

When you go to the barber shop  / hairdresser what do you guys ask for?

-Slick haircuts btw;even Bencel

Hi its Juves the soloq goblin,

LOL at rogues comment.

I say give me a 0 on the sides and back, leave some length on the top because I slick it back then say I want a high, medium or low fade. Usually a 0 into 1.5 or 2 look clean.
